item.title: Biggest dinosaur footprint site discovered from 166 million years - Dunya News
item.description:
Biggest Dinosaur Footprint Site Discovered from 166 Million Years

Published On: Mon, 06 Jan 2025 07:21:09 PKT

Scientists from Oxford and Birmingham have uncovered a significant find of dinosaur footprints dating back 166 million years, providing insights into the lives of long-extinct giants.

  • Discovery includes five extensive dinosaur trackways.
  • The longest trackway measures 150m and belongs to long-necked herbivores, likely Cetiosaurus.
  • A Megalosaurus track has also been identified among the finds.
  • The footprints were found at Dewars Farm Quarry in Oxfordshire.
  • Full-scale excavation involved over 100 scientists and volunteers.
  • More than 20,000 photographs were taken to create a 3D model of the site.
  • This find builds on previous discoveries from 1997 in the same area.
“These uniquely well-preserved tracks reveal stunning insights into the lives of the long-extinct giants.”

This discovery is crucial in understanding the prehistoric ecosystem and may reveal more tracks in future excavations.

item.title: After HMPV outbreak in China, Maharashtra intensifies surveillance for respiratory disease cases - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Maharashtra Boosts Surveillance Following HMPV Outbreak in China

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Following the outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in China, the health department in Maharashtra has heightened surveillance for respiratory infections. The director of health services has instructed officials to report severe acute respiratory infections (SARI) and influenza-like illnesses (ILI).

  • No reported cases of HMPV in Maharashtra yet.
  • The HMPV is a common respiratory virus that primarily affects the upper respiratory tract.
  • Officials assure the public there is no need for alarm.
  • The situation in China corresponds to the seasonal flu pattern.
  • The government is in close watch and has requested updates from WHO regarding the situation in China.
“There is no need for the citizens to panic and the officials are asked to submit reports of SARI and ILI cases,” Dr Nitin Ambadekar stated.

In conclusion, while there is an outbreak in China, Maharashtra is maintaining a proactive approach to ensure public safety, with no immediate threat present locally.

item.title: Reason Behind Rohit Sharma's Interview? Manjrekar Says "Gautam Gambhir Was Getting Credit For..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Reason Behind Rohit Sharma's Interview? Manjrekar Says "Gautam Gambhir Was Getting Credit For..."

Publication Date: January 5, 2025, Source: NDTV

India captain Rohit Sharma's future as a Test cricketer is under scrutiny following his omission from the recent Test series against Australia. He addressed his situation in a recent interview.

  • Rohit was dropped from the Sydney Test, raising questions about his role in the team's future.
  • In an interview, he stated he is not retiring but opted out due to poor form.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar suggested the interview aimed to clarify his situation, noting Gautam Gambhir was receiving credit for his exclusion.
  • Manjrekar emphasized that players should respect the decisions made by the chairman of selectors regarding their future.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” said Manjrekar.

The future of Rohit Sharma remains uncertain, and his recent statements may reflect a desire to reshape the narrative around his Test career.

item.title: How Team India's decade of dominance ended against Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
How Team India's Decade of Dominance Ended Against Australia

Date: SYDNEY
Source: Times of India

Australia crush India inside three days to bag the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, marking the end of India’s dominance in Test cricket over the last decade.

  • Australia won the series 1-3, regaining the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India's batting lineup was criticized for its inconsistency and lack of depth.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was over-reliant on due to injuries affecting the team's overall performance.
  • The team showed a lack of strategy and execution on the field leading to their defeat.
“No amount of white-ball bashing in docile conditions can erase the consequences of this series defeat.”

This series has raised questions about India's Test cricket future and their strategy moving forward, highlighting a need for leadership and innovation within the team.

item.title: Circular has an app to make sure its new smart ring fits perfectly on your finger - Android Authority
item.description:
Circular has an app to make sure its new smart ring fits perfectly on your finger

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Android Authority

The Circular Ring 2 is the latest smart ring from Circular, featuring advanced health tracking capabilities and a new app designed for easy sizing.

  • The Circular Ring 2 is a follow-up to the company’s first device.
  • It features an FDA-cleared AFib detection algorithm and ECG capabilities.
  • The new smart ring will be available for $380 in February or March 2025.
“This tool you can use with your smartphone is the first of its kind in the space.”

Circular's innovative approach aims to enhance user experience in fitness tracking by ensuring a perfect fit with a digital sizing tool.

item.title: Circular’s new smart ring has a built-in ECG - Engadget
item.description:
Circular's New Smart Ring Features Built-in ECG Monitoring

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Engadget

The new Circular Ring 2 unveiled at CES 2025 includes innovative heart-monitoring functionalities and enhanced design elements.

  • Introduces a built-in ECG feature.
  • Improved sensors and an eight-day battery life.
  • Redesigned companion app for better user experience.
  • Cased in titanium with options in Gold, Silver, Black, and Rose Gold.
  • Scheduled to release in February or March 2025 at a price point of $380.
“A more intuitive and refined user experience.”

This advancement in smart ring technology showcases a significant step forward in wearable health monitoring devices.

item.title: This fuzzy, purse-mounted robot is designed to ‘delight bystanders’ - TechCrunch
item.description:
This fuzzy, purse-mounted robot is designed to ‘delight bystanders’

Date: 2 hours ago | Source: TechCrunch

Yukai Engineering has unveiled its latest creation, Mirumi, at CES 2025. This charming robot is designed to elicit joy and curiosity in bystanders by mimicking behaviors reminiscent of babies.

  • Mirumi is a purse-mounted robot that features a furball design.
  • It turns its head to engage with nearby people, promoting interaction.
  • The robot expresses curiosity and bashfulness through movement.
  • Various interaction modes include curiosity, inquisitiveness, bashfulness, rejection, and comfort.
“Designed to re-create people’s joyful experiences of noticing a human baby,” said Yukai Engineering.

This innovative robot aims to add a layer of delight to everyday experiences.

item.title: BPSC protest: Bihar Police detains Prashant Kishor from Gandhi Maidan in Patna - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Detained During Hunger Strike for BPSC Exam Protest

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

Prashant Kishor, chief of Jan Suraaj, has been detained by Bihar Police while on an indefinite hunger strike at Gandhi Maidan, protesting against irregularities in the BPSC examination and demanding the cancellation of the integrated 70th combined competitive test conducted in December.

  • Kishor's hunger strike aimed to draw attention to alleged irregularities in the BPSC examination.
  • He claims the government's decision to conduct a re-examination acknowledges errors in the initial testing process.
  • Over 12,000 candidates were called for a fresh test; however, only 5,943 appeared.
  • Kishor has called for political support to amplify the protest.
“By conducting the re-examination, the government has legally accepted that irregularities have happened with certain students in the examination.” – Prashant Kishor

This ongoing protest highlights significant concerns regarding the integrity of public examinations in Bihar and the need for government accountability.

item.title: Delhi authorities issue guidelines to prevent HMPV breakout - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Authorities Issue Guidelines to Prevent HMPV Breakout

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: Delhi Health Department

Delhi health authorities issued an advisory to prepare for potential health challenges related to the Human MetaPneumoVirus (HMPV) and other respiratory viruses.

  • Dr. Vandana Bagga convened a meeting with medical officials to discuss respiratory illness preparedness.
  • Hospitals must report Influenza-like Illness (ILI) and Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI) cases.
  • Strict isolation protocols and universal precautions for suspected cases are mandatory.
  • Proper documentation of SARI and lab-confirmed influenza cases is required.
  • Hospitals should ensure the availability of treatment supplies like paracetamol and oxygen.
Updates indicated no significant surge in respiratory illnesses as of January 2, 2025.

The guidelines follow reports of increased respiratory illnesses in China and highlight the importance of preparedness.

item.title: Weekly deals: a look at renewed iPhone 16, 15, 14 and 13-series models - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Weekly deals: a look at renewed iPhone 16, 15, 14 and 13-series models

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the availability and features of renewed iPhones following major shopping events. It focuses on models from the iPhone 16 series down to the iPhone 13 series, highlighting their prices, features, and trade-in options.

  • Renewed iPhone 16 models are available at similar prices to new ones, with potential savings on higher storage options.
  • iPhone 15 series introduced USB-C connectivity and features like Apple Intelligence, although the vanilla models lack some new controls.
  • The iPhone 14 series still uses the Lightning adapter but includes models with 48MP main cameras in their Pro versions.
  • The iPhone 13 series offers a compact option with the mini model and features 12MP main cameras.
  • Amazon offers trade-in deals of up to $220 for renewed phones.
“Apple devices rarely go on sale, so they are rarely featured in these weekly posts.”

This overview highlights the offerings of renewed iPhones and their advantages, especially post-holiday shopping.

item.title: Salman Khan's Galaxy Apartment undergoes renovation to enhance security amid safety concerns - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Salman Khan's Galaxy Apartment Renovation Enhances Security

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Salman Khan's famous Galaxy Apartment is undergoing renovations aimed at enhancing the security measures due to increasing safety concerns.

  • The renovation comes after a series of reported safety issues in the area.
  • Security personnel are being deployed to monitor the premises around the clock.
  • Improvements to building infrastructure are also being planned to better safeguard residents.
"The safety of residents is our top priority, and these upgrades are essential." – A representative from Salman Khan's management.

The ongoing renovations reflect a growing emphasis on safety and security in celebrity residences, setting a precedent for other public figures.

item.title: Hamas says ready to release 34 hostages in 'first phase' of exchange deal - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hamas Announces Plans to Release 34 Hostages in Exchange Deal

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: AFP

A senior Hamas official announced that the group is ready to release 34 Israeli hostages as the first phase of a potential exchange deal, but there are ongoing negotiations regarding the details of the release.

  • Hamas is prepared to release 34 Israeli prisoners defined by a list provided by Israel.
  • The release encompasses women, children, elderly, and sick captives held in Gaza.
  • Israeli PM's office stated that Hamas has not yet submitted a list of hostages for release.
  • Out of 251 hostages taken during the October 7, 2023 attack, 96 are still held in Gaza.
"Hamas has agreed to release the 34 prisoners, whether alive or dead. However, the group needs a week of calm to communicate with the captors and identify those who are alive and those who are dead."

The situation remains fluid as negotiations continue, with a focus on ensuring the safety of those involved in the negotiations for prisoner exchanges.

item.title: LG Unveils 2025 Premium OLED TVs With Ground-Breaking Brightness, Advanced AI Features And 165Hz Gaming Support - Forbes
item.description:
LG Unveils 2025 Premium OLED TVs With Ground-Breaking Brightness, Advanced AI Features And 165Hz Gaming Support

Publication Date: January 7, 2025   Source: Forbes

LG has revealed its 2025 range of premium “Evo” OLED TVs at CES in Las Vegas, showcasing innovative features aimed at enhancing the movie and gaming experience.

  • Both OLED Evo M5 and G5 series will feature the new Alpha 11 Gen 2 processor for improved picture and sound quality.
  • A Brightness Booster Ultimate system claims to enhance brightness peaks three times higher than regular OLED TVs.
  • The M5 and G5 support 4K/165Hz gaming signals and include capabilities for virtual 11.1.2 surround sound.
  • The TVs introduce an AI Picture and Sound Wizard to tailor settings based on user preferences.
  • The new Filmmaker Mode features Ambient Light Compensation for consistent HDR experiences.
“Perfect Black” and “Perfect Color” verification from independent assessor UL Solutions.

LG's latest OLEDs promise substantial advancements in brightness and audio capabilities while integrating AI features to enhance user experience.

item.title: LG's OLED evo TVs for 2025 come with AI and a 165Hz refresh rate - Engadget
item.description:
LG's OLED evo TVs for 2025 come with AI and a 165Hz refresh rate

Date: January 2025 | Source: Engadget

LG has announced its new OLED evo TV lineup for 2025, featuring the latest α (Alpha) 11 AI processor Gen2, with groundbreaking visual capabilities and enhanced audio features, showcased at CES 2025.

  • Powered by the α (Alpha) 11 AI processor Gen2 for improved image quality.
  • First in the industry to offer 4K resolution at 165Hz refresh rate.
  • Enhanced Brightness Booster Ultimate technology delivering three times higher brightness.
  • Top-notch black levels, verified by UL Solutions.
  • AI Sound Pro delivering 11.1.2 channels of surround sound.
  • AI Remote recognizes individual voices for personalized recommendations.
  • M5 series supports wireless audio and video transmission at up to 144Hz without sacrificing quality.
“LG promises top-notch black levels” - LG spokesperson

With these advancements, LG aims to elevate the viewing experience, focusing on both visual and audio innovations that cater to modern entertainment needs.

item.title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
item.description:
BJP Leader's Sexist Comments on Priyanka Gandhi Spark Outrage from Congress

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

A massive political row erupted after BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri made sexist remarks about Priyanka Gandhi, claiming that if his party comes to power, it would build 'roads like Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks'. The Congress party condemned his comments and announced plans to file an FIR against him.

  • BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri faced backlash for his remarks referring to Priyanka Gandhi.
  • Congress announced intentions to file an FIR against Bidhuri.
  • Bidhuri later expressed regret and stated he took his words back.
  • Congress leaders criticized the BJP, labeling them as 'anti-women'.
“Everyone has sisters, daughters, and mothers at home.” - Alka Lamba, Congress candidate

The controversy reveals ongoing tensions between BJP and Congress, framing the upcoming elections amidst accusations of misogyny and insensitivity within the BJP.

item.title: Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya Bring Tail Of India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike - News18
item.description:
Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya Unveil India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

The trailer of Akshay Kumar’s much-awaited movie, Sky Force, is finally out, showcasing the backdrop of the 1965 India-Pakistan Air War. Akshay Kumar returns in an intense role, alongside newcomer Veer Pahariya as Indian Air Force officers.

  • The trailer reveals Akshay giving a stern warning to Pakistan before launching India’s first airstrike.
  • Veer Pahariya goes missing during the strike, heightening the film's tension.
  • Sara Ali Khan plays Veer’s love interest while notable stars like Nirmat Kaur and Sharad Kelkar also join the cast.
  • The film is directed by Sandeep Kewlani and Abhishek Kapur and produced by Dinesh Vijan, Amar Kaushik, and Jyoti Deshpande.
“This Republic Day, witness the untold story of a heroic sacrifice – the tale of India’s first and deadliest airstrike.” - Akshay Kumar

Fans express excitement over the trailer, with many praising Kumar's uniform look and Veer's promising performance. Sky Force is set for a global release on January 24, 2025, coinciding with the Republic Day weekend.

item.title: Roborock's new vacuum can pick up loose socks for you with its robotic arm - Mashable
item.description:
CES 2025: Roborock's newest vacuum can pick up loose socks for you

Publication Date: 2025
Source: Mashable

Roborock has announced a new robot vacuum, the Saros Z70, at CES 2025. This unique vacuum features a robotic arm designed to pick up various small items, making it ideal for households with kids.

  • The Roborock Saros Z70 is a circular robot vacuum with a foldable robotic arm called OmniGrip.
  • It is capable of collecting small items weighing under 300 grams, including socks and tissue paper.
  • The vacuum is set to launch in the first half of 2025, but pricing details have not yet been announced.
"Roborock insists it's the first-of-its-kind mass-produced foldable robotic arm on a robot vacuum."

This innovation could significantly improve the convenience of maintaining cleanliness in homes with children.

item.title: Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut | Explained - News18
item.description:
Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Delhi section of the RRTS, marking the arrival of Namo Bharat trains in the capital. This 13-km section connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar, completing a 55 km corridor with 11 stations.

  • The operation will begin at 5 pm with trains available every 15 minutes.
  • The fare ranges from Rs 20 to Rs 225 depending on the coach type.
  • This section has been operational for 50 lakh commuters to date.
  • The corridor will reduce travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South to under 40 minutes.
  • Multi-modal integration with existing transport systems will be available at Anand Vihar station.
“The entire Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor is projected to remove over one lakh private vehicles from the roads and reduce carbon emissions by 2.5 lakh tonnes annually.”

The new RRTS service aims to ease commuter congestion and enhance travel efficiency between Delhi and neighboring areas.
